SAF bombs Kodei in Central Darfur. No fatality.
SAF bombs Boori in Central Darfur. No fatality.

ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Armed men in uniform rob the UNAMID residence in Dereiga.
SAF bombs Kwila in Central Darfur. No fatality.
SAF bombs Marra in Central Darfur. No fatality.
SAF bombs Sarrong in Central Darfur. 2 killed and 8 injured.
SAF bombs Tui in North Darfur. No fatality.
SAF bombs Marra in Central Darfur. 8 killed and 2 injured.
SAF bombs Fouli in Central Darfur. No fatality.
SAF bombs Kutrum. 3 injured.
SAF bombs villages in Nertiti, Central Darfur. 6 killed and 18 injured.
Alleged aerial bombardement by SAF on Nertiti area left 6 people killed and 18 injured.
SAF bombs Sarrong in Central Darfur, leaving one person killed.

ACTOR1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
NOTES: SLM/AW abducted two humanitarian workers in Sortony, North Darfur, over spying for the Government. They released them the same day.
SAF fired two shells on civilian settlements controlled by SPLM/N in Umhetan town, Delami county. No casualties.
Clashes between members of the Falata and Salamat tribes over cattle-rustling in Wad Hagam near Buram, South Darfur, left around five people dead.

Two Maalia tribesmen were killed by Rizaygat militiamen in Abu Karaynka, East Darfur, on 14 and 15 October, following a series of cattle-rustling incidents, raising fears of renewed clashes between the two groups. The two sides failed to reach an agreement at a peace meeting held in Abu Haraz area near Khartoum a few months before.
SAF fired three shells on Alnugra village, Tangal Payam, damaging a farm.
SAF fired 27 shells on Umserndiba village, Tangal payam. No casualties.
Demonstration by IDPs from Sese camp in El Geneina, West Darfur. Authorities arrested at least six leaders of the camp the following two days.
PDF militia looted 180 cows from three families in Hadara village, Umhetan payam in Delami county.
PDF militia shot and seriously injured a widow working on her darm in Kadugli county.

Clashes between the Awlad Zaid subclan of the northern Rizaygat and Zaghawa tribesmen in Kulbus in Jebel Moon locality pver 30-31 October left 16 people killed and several adbucted on both sides. Two days later, West Darfur authorities banned UNAMID air and ground operations in El Geneina after the agency cancelled a flight to Jebel Moon to monitor the situation over security and time concerns".
Clashes between members of the Falata and Salamat tribes over cattle-rustling in Nadhif near Buram, South Darfur, left around five people dead.
Clashes between Rizaygat and Masalit tribesmen over the attempted rape of Masalit girls by armed Rizaygat in Um Sharanah near Gereida left six dead.
PDF militiamen abducted a man while working on his farm in Tembera village, Kumbur payam, Heiban county.

Masalit farmers killed two Rizaygat nomads who allegedly grazed their cattle on their farm in Dimasoya in Goghana area, South Darfur. Retaliatory attacks over the next two days in Goghana and Dimasoya led to clashes that resulted in the further killing of 21 Rizaygat and 10 Masalit tribesmen. (first day's fatalities coded in other event)

ACTOR1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
NOTES: SLM/AW reportedly attacked Sudanese forces in Sarrong, Central Darfur, injuring 16 soldiers.
SAF fired four shells on Alnugra village and five shells on Umserndiba village, Tangal payam. No casualties.
SAF fired four shells on Alnugra village and five shells on Umserndiba village, Tangal payam. No casualties.
SAF fired eight rockets on Ardicanan illage in Heiban, injuring a civilian travelling to the village market and burning down three huts.
SAF dropped two bombs on Lula village in Al Azraq payam. No casualties.

ACTOR1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
NOTES: Sudanese forces attacked SLM/AW positions east of Nertiti in retaliation for an earlier attack by the group. Impact of the attack is unclear due to lack of access to the area.
Clash between government and SPLM-N forces in Jardan, Deim Mansur area of central Blue Nile state. No reported fatality.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: NISS arrested a man in El Gedaref over his suspected link with the SLM and beat him in detention at Khartoum's Kober prison. He was released early January.
Unknown gunmen kill a Sudanese soldier in Nertiti.

SOURCE: Radio Dabanga; Al Jazeera; Nuba Reports
NOTES: Suspected government soldiers under the command of Col El Tayib attacked Nertiti allegedly in response to the killing of a soldier by unknown gunmen two days prior. At least nine civilians were killed and 69 others injured, including several policemen who sought to protect the residents and then withdrew from their headquarters. The government blames SLM-AW but local reports and witnesses blame the pro-government militias and formal military forces.
Three people were injured, and several women reportedly miscarried in the early hours of Sunday morning, when regular and militia forces opened fire during New Year celebrations in Zalingei.
Unidentified gunmen reportedly killed 11 people at an IDP camp in Jebel Marra on 1 January.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: Report of torture and overcrowding in various NISS prisons in Sudan by a prisoner detained between 18 December and 22 January. Detainees from Darfur are reportedly particularly ill-treated. Cases of Ehiopian Oromos also detained after seeking asylum in Sudan.
NCP alligned students launch a gun attack on other students at Dilling university, severely injuring 6 students.
Students affiliated with the NCP and other students at Dilling University clash after NCP students lauch a gun attack on other students the previous day.
Two men were shot dead by militants at Fanga, north-east of Jebel Marra
A farmer was shot dead near Garsila in Central Darfur when he refused to leave his farm to militants who claimed to 'liberate'  the land.
Six armed men in military uniforms attacked four displaced men who went fishing at Rahad Abu Idresa. One person killed.
Police detained eight students of the University of Khartoum's Omdurman campus protesting against their expulsion from the Faculty of Education, and sentenced them the following week to 20 lashes.

RSF along with police battle with a group of cattle herders seeking their stolen livestock. 7 people dead, including a child, and eight others wounded. Other officials claim authorities used stolen livestock as a pretext to target a former opposition group leader residing in the town.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: A vigil carried out by the families and supporters of detainees in front of the headquarters of the National Intelligence and Security Service (NISS) in Khartoum. The NISS dispersed the protest.
A group of seven alleged Janjaweed ambush a group of ten children near Keyo village close to Sortony camp in North Darfur, and abduct two.
Residents of Abyei region protested against the hiring of foreign labor by companies working for the UN Security Force.

Darfur students of various universities in Khartoum staged a demonstration in protest against the recent violence against civilians in Nierteti and El Geneina, calling for an independant commission of inquiry into the events. Police allegedly dispersed the students with excessive force and tear gas, causing several to faint. At least one student leader was arrested.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: NISS arrests the chairman of the opposition Sudanese Congress Party (SCoP) at Khartoum airport, using alleged excessive force to prevent him from boarding his flight and taking him to an unknown location. He was released a month later, on 7 February. The Chairman of the Civil Society Initiative is also banned from traveling with his family a few days later, on 12 January, and opposition leaders prevented from leaving the country to attend a Sudan Call meeting in France on 14 January.
SPLM-N accuses government forces and SRF militiamen of attacking its positions in Arum area, Blue Nile. No reported fatality.
Unknown gunmen opened fire on a rickshaw carrying 13 displaced people on their way from Sergeila market to Gireida, South Darfur, killing two and injuring another eight.

Demonstrators hold a vigil in Khartoum, demanding the release of political detainees. The demonstrators included families of the detainees and members of the National Consensus Forces. Security forces reportedly beat the protesters with batons, arrested at least three, and prevented them from handing a memorendum to authorities.
An RSF member was killed and robbed west of El Kasr by unknown attackers.

Militant students of the ruling NCP stormed a press conference held by fellow students from the University of Khartoum who had just received a sentence for protesting in Omdurman the week before. They were holding knifes, metak bars and guns, and some of them shot in air.
Three militiamen opened fire on basic school pupils in El Kasr, east of Kutum town, leaving one of them killed.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a group of displaced people from Otash camp in Nyala, leaving one killed and two injured.
People in Sebu in Northern state protested against a new gold extracting factory in the area. After four days or protest, the Governor of Northern state withdrew the permit of the mining company.
An unknown assaillant stabbed an IDP to death in Kassab camp in Kutum locality.
Gunmen abducted a man and two of his sons in front of a mosque in Nyala. They released the boys soon after, while the father was freed the following day by security forces.
People in Sebu in Northern state protested against a new gold extracting factory in the area. After four days or protest, the Governor of Northern state withdrew the permit of the mining company.
Seven armed men opened fire at the Saraf Saada Koran school near Mukjar to steal sorghum from its stores, leaving four people injured. At least one of the attackers was arrested.
Five gunmen opened fire on a group of IDPs from Sortony camp on their way to the Rokoro market, leaving one killed and another seriously wounded.
Government militiamen reportedly abducted two firewood collectors in Tirbowa village near Dubbo el Omda in Tawila locality.
Gunmen opened fire on three herders in Umkadawiya north east of El Fasher, leaving one killed, the other two injured, and stealing 170 camels.
Activists and residents protested in a number of villages in South Kordofan against the installation of a new gold extraction factory in Bajoun locality. Several activists were arrested.
People in Sebu in Northern state protested against a new gold extracting factory in the area. After four days or protest, the Governor of Northern state withdrew the permit of the mining company.
Five militiamen severely beat a group of women collecting straw near Tabit with whips, leaving four injured.

People of El Sunout in El Gezira staged a demonstration on the Wad Madani-Sennar road, calling for the release of the chairman of the SCP and all other political detainees. NISS refused to accept their memo the previous day in El Gezira.
Government forces and militiamen reportedly attacked SPLM-N positions in Alrum area of Blue Nile and were repulsed. At least one rebel fighter was injured.

Armed men attacked a commercial vehicle on its way to Kabkabiya from camp Sabagel Kheil, leaving a displaced man injured with a bullet wound. On the same day, unknown gunmen also abducted an IDP from Sortony camp at the livestock market in Kabkabiya.

The Sudanese parliament integrated the RSF militia (exceeding 30,000 forces) into the Sudanese army and gave the President the power to appoint its commander and merge it with the national army as and when required. The militia had so far been operating under the command of NISS, with relative autonomy. Darfuri resistance forces have denounced the Act as a codification and establishment of a second parallel army in the country.
People in Sebu in Northern state protested against a new gold extracting factory in the area. After four days or protest, the Governor of Northern state withdrew the permit of the mining company.
A man and his camel were killed when a remnant of war exploded in Jenna in East Jebel Marra, near Tabit.
Dozens of women gathered in front of the military garrison of Tabit to demand the release of the Omda of Dobo El Omda, arrested in November 2016, and other political prisoners.
Gunmen beat three men with rifle butts and sticks as they were collecting firewood northeast of Tur. One of them was left in a coma and the other two were injured.
Armed men shot and killed a Chadian refugee from Um Shalaya camp in Azum locality under unclear circumstances.
Clash between pastoralists at a water point in Elromal in El Tadamon locality, South Kordofan, over whose cattle should have priority, left 11 injured.

Members of a paramilitary group shot at two secondary school pupils in the Karkawiya district in eastern Kutum as they refused to hand them their belongings, and abducted the children. They demanded a ransom a week later.

Vigil by Sudanese Republican Party supporters near the Presidential Palace in Khartoum to commemorate the Republican Brotherhood leader Mahmoud Mohammed Taha executed 32 years ago. Days before the vigil, NISS summoned six of the leaders of the Republican Party.
Unknown gunmen opened fire on two IDPs returning to Hassahissa camp in Zalingei town, leaving one of them severely injured.
Three unknown gunmen abducted a girl and her cows in Barakande area in North Darfur.

ACTOR1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
NOTES: A splinter faction of the SLM-AW led by Sadiq Adam Abdel-Karim (aka Fouka) and made of 1,500 fighters, signed a peace agreement with the Sudanese government in El-Fasher, after three months of secret negotiations. SLM-AW denied the claim, saying Fouka individually defected from the rebel group to the government and the news of a peace agreement was a lie by the government to cover up abuses.
A clash between a Sudanese soldier and a nomad at the Arara market in Beida locality, West Darfur, led to large groups of nomads storming the market.
In response to a previous clash with a soldier, nomadds storm the market place and attack people, leaving five people injured and a number of gardens in the area destroyed by fire.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Dozens of former local UNAMID staff protested in front of the missions premises in El-Fasher for alleged non-payment of financial dues since 2010. Similar protests were held in 2016.
Two displaced people were wounded at Forika IDP camp in South Darfurs Gireida locality when they were hit by a police car chasing other camp residents.

SOURCE: Agence France Presse -- English; Radio Dabanga; Sudan Tribune
NOTES: Detained human rights defender Mudawi Ibrahim Adam began a hunger strike at Kober prison. He ended his strike a week later but resumed it again on 2 February. Authorities repeatedly denied visitation rights by his family since his arrest early December.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Military Intelligence Service
ALLY_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: Military intelligence agents and police arrested and detained a man from Forika IDP camp in Gereida, South Darfur. He was severely beaten in detention, and released the following day. The officers were initially looking for his brother at the camp.
Militiamen kidnapped a man from Eirli camp in Kass locality. They released him the following day after payment of a ransom.

Darfuri students held a sit-in at the Faculty of Animal Production of the University of Khartoum to protest the university administrations dismissal of five of their colleagues a few days prior. Six students were arrested by police for organising the sit-in.

Herders attacked three people south of Tabit as they were returning from collecting straw, and shot and killed one of them as he refused to hand them the straw. In a separate incident on the same day, four herders assaulted and beat three women on their way to Hashaba village, also south of Tabit, setting fire to the straw that they had collected.

RSF militiamen raided a villager north of Tabit in North Darfur, beating a number of villagers including severely who fell in a coma, and stealing villagers' money, and quantities of sorghum, sesame, beans, dry okra and tobacco.
Clashes between members of the Misseriya and Rizeigat tribes left three killed, including two Misseriya, in the eastern district of Um Dukhn in West Darfur.
Three armed herdsmen shot and killed a firewood collector north of Mashrou Abu Zeid in East Jebel Marra as he refused to hand them his property. The assaillants fled with his two horses.

Security forces reportedly prevented journalists from entering Khartoum's airport to cover the return of Imam El Sadig El Mahdi, the President of the National Umma Party, after an exile of more than two years abroad. At least one journalist was beaten and detained. Delegations of people coming from White Nile and Sennar states were also reportedly blocked from entering Khartoum city to see the leader, but allowed in later after the end of the reception ceremony.
Six gunmen hijacked a commercial vehicle on its way from Nierteti to Zalingei in Central Darfur at Shawa, beating some of the passengers and robbing all of them of their belongings.

Report of a siege by armed herders on Tabit and its neighbouring villages in North Darfur, asserting that the land is specified for their cattle to graze. The herders have been preventing local populations from going out to collect firewood and straw.

Unknown gunmen ambushed a displaced woman from the Fata Borno camp in North Darfur's Kutum locality as she was returning from her orchard to the camp, beating her with rifles, leaving her seriously injured.
Clash between cattle raiders and locals in Duqqu area west of El Fasher left one killed, one injured and 95 cows stolen.

Residents of Imtidad El Daraja El Talta district in Khartoum tried to protest digging work in their neighborhood but were dispersed by joint army and police forces using sticks and battons. At least three protesters were arrested. The security force surrounded the neighborhood in the days that followed, preventing residents from leaving or entering the area.
A group of three armed herders stormed the El Addar School outside El Geneina, and repeatedly raped two female teachers. Two suspected were later arrested, while one escaped.

Dozens of family members, teachers, youth and the two victims marched in front of the Ministry of Education of West Darfur in El Geneina to protest the rape of two school teachers on 31 January in nearby Addar village, calling for the authorities to arrest the rest of the perpetrators. The General Federation for teachers and state workers threatened to strike if authorities failed to arrest the culprits.

Islamist militants toured New Halfa in Kassala state with loudspeakers to protest a concert by a popular singer in the town later in the evening and issued fatwa to prohibit her singing. During the concert, they were suspected of throwing tear gas on attendees, bringing a stop to the concert. Police intervened to protect the singer and the audience.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CCSD: Central Committee of Sudanese Doctors
NOTES: CCSD held a sit-in outside the health minitry in Khartoum during the week of 27 January to reiterate their demands for protection. Following the murder of a doctor in his private clinin in Sennar town. NISS arrested and briefly detained the chairman of the CCSD on 5 February as a result.

Detained human rights defender Mudawi Ibrahim Adam began a hunger strike for the second time in two weeks at Kober prison. Authorities repeatedly denied visitation rights by his family since his arrest early December.
Unknown gunmen raped two girls on their way from Um Driseih to their village in Musku in Manawashi locality, South Darfur, leaving one of them severely injured.
Report of militia and herder attacks on Balidy Serif, Libi, and Swanee in Jebel Marra around 2 February, having forced dozens of families to flee to Shaddad camp of Shangil Tobaya.

Dozens of residents of the Imtidad El Daraja El Talta district in Khartoumstaged a demonsration to protest the sale of the districts only public square to an investor. Security forces and police intervened, using tear gas to disperse the protesters, and arrested at least two during the protest.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-); PDF: Popular Defence Forces; Vigilante Militia (Sudan)
NOTES: Clashes between cattle raiders and a joint army, police, PDF and vigilante force who had gone to recover stolen cattle in Jebel Mala, south of Korma in North Darfur's El Fasher. At least four killed and four wounded among security and vigilante forces.

A student set fire to a police office at Khartoum university. Police arrested the student three days later, and released him on bail later that day. On the day of his arrest, fellow students held a peaceful march to protest his arrest. The march was dispersed by police with teargas.

Sudanese forces opened fire on the families of 20 women prisoners who were peacefully protesting their planned transfer from the Kabkabiya Women's Prison to a prison in El Fasher, leaving one killed and another seriously injured. The women were transferred to El Fasher by air later that day.

A paramilitary group intercepted a passenger lorry in the Nena area, on the road linking Kutum with El Fasher, threatening to shoot the passengers if they did not give them their belongings. No casualty.
Unknown gunmen beat and abducted two men in Kutum, taking them to an unknown destination west of the town.
Unknown militiamen shot dead a man and cut the ear of another as they refused to hand them their belongings in the Sangar district of western Kutum, North Darfur.
Clashes between members of the Rizeigat and Ma'aliya tribes over cattle theft in Tullus locality in South Darfur left two tribesmen killed and another injured.

A student stabbed an RSF militiaman to death following a scuffle as the militiaman was trying to rob the student of his mobile phone at Maureen market at Hamidiya in Zalingei. After the incident, supporters and relatives of the dead militiaman stormed and pillaged the students residence at the university of Zalingei (after police evacuated the students), and ransacked the Maureen market at Hamidiya.
Gunmen in military uniforms ambushed two vehicles on the highway at Hillet Ahmed, near Tabit in North Darfur, on 6 and 7 February, robbing people of their belongings.

A student set fire to a police office at Khartoum university. Police arrested the student three days later, and released him on bail later that day. On the day of his arrest, fellow students held a peaceful march to protest his arrest. The march was dispersed by police with teargas.
A splinter SPLM-N faction led by Fadul Allah Issa Abu Kaiaan signed the National Document in Khartoum, expressing their willingness to join the peace process.

A student stabbed an RSF militiaman to death following a scuffle as the militiaman was trying to rob the student of his mobile phone at Maureen market at Hamidiya in Zalingei. After the incident, supporters and relatives of the dead militiaman stormed and pillaged the students residence at the university of Zalingei (after police evacuated the students), and ransacked the Maureen market at Hamidiya.
Unknown gunman opened fire on a commercial truck on the Amiet-Mayen Abun road, leaving one person killed and four others injured.
Gunmen in military uniform ambushed a lorry near Al-Rafa village in Tadamoun locality in South Kordofan, leaving the driver shot and wounded.

ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Gunmen ambushed a convoy escorting Sudan's Second Vice-President on his way to open a health centre at El Zariba district east of Kutum, hijacking a UNAMID vehicle while the rest of the convoy escaped. Sudanese forces recovered the vehicle later.
Basic and secondary school teachers and employees began a three-day strike in El Salam locality, West Kordofan, to protest the non-payment of their financial dues for months.
A group of seven militiamen shot and killed three herders at Tamara, east of Fanga in Darfur, as they were grazing their cows, stealing 45 of them.

Hundreds of residents of Kologi, Talodi locality in South Kordofan, protested in front of the locality's headquarters and the security service office calling for the shutting down of a gold mining factory that uses environmentally hazardous cyanide to extract gold.

Three militiamen ambushed a vehicle on the road between Kunjara and Tabit in Tawila locality, North Darfur, abducting the driver and his family. A rescue team later managed to recover the family and the vehicle.

SOURCE: Sudan Tribune; Xinhua General News Service; Radio Dabanga
NOTES: Unknown militiamen attacked a group of cattle herders from the Hawazma tribe at Al-Hujairat area of South Kordofan, near the capital Kadugli, in an apparent revenge attack over cattle theft, leaving seven killed, another injured and 1,500 heads of cattle stolen. Ruling party accused SPLM-N while SPLM-N denied having forces in the area.
In Kolelo village, a group of pastoralists attacked a peasant with a machete, believing that he was a police informant, because he was talking on his cellphone. He died at the hospital in Morogoro
A man was attacked by a mob in Mbigiri village as part of ongoing fighting between pastoralists and farmers. The police have arrested 37 people.
Around 500 people held a demonstration to call for the protection of elephants and the banning of the ivory trade.

A group of Maasai herders armed themselves to rescue the livestock confiscated for grazing in the Meru Game Reserve. There was a confrontation with the guards and 4 Maasai were killed. Several others, including a child.
People who returned to the Nduta Refugee Camp after the new 8pm curfew were attacked by police officers.
Unknown gunmen shot and killed 11 Ghanaians returning home from Nigeria along the border with Benin over unclear reasons.
Riots erupted in Ben Gardane following the closure of the border crossing post in Ras Ajdir. Clashes with police forces and several arrests were reported.

Violent riots took place around Ben Gardane on 15 June 2010. There were reports of damaged properties, burning tyres used to block the roads and clashes with the police. Reports of police assaults on civilians also emerged.
A peaceful sit-in was violently dispersed by the police in Ben Gardane. The protesters were denouncing police repression during the riots occurred a few days earlier.
The region of Meknassi in Sidi Bouzid witnessed a demonstration on Monday demanding the acceleration of the works in the local phosphate mining site.
The citizens of Feriana blocked the route of the town with burning tyres and trunks demanding the developemtn of the town.
Construction workers staged a nationwide strike. In Jendouba, the workers organised a protest march outside the offices of the Regional Labour Union.

SOURCE: Tunis Afrique Presse; Shems FM; Panapress
NOTES: Police intervened on January 3 in Ennour neighbourhood of Kasserine to disperse rioters. The demonstrators destroyed properties and attacked public buildings.
Construction workers staged a nationwide strike. In Jendouba, the workers organised a protest march outside the offices of the Regional Labour Union.
A strike was organised in Kebili by temporary workers.
UGTT teachers organised a general strike across the Tunisian territory.
Civil society organisations staged a protest in the centre of Beni Khiar demanding the creation of an enquiry commission over a train accident that killed 5 people.

About 1,000 people protested in central Tunis on Sunday against allowing Tunisians who had fought with jihadists abroad back into the country. Protesters at Sunday's rally -- many wrapped in Tunisians flags -- shouted "No to returning terrorists!" and "All Tunisians against terrorism!"
Construction workers went on strike on Monday across Tunisia.
A pacific march took place in Kasserine, organised by civil society associations and youths. They demanded development and jobs.
Protesters assaulted the offices of the governorate in Sidi Bouzid. Police evacuated the site, injuring some protesters.
Gunshots were fired across the Tunisian - Libyan border in the area of Remada. No Tunisian soldiers were injured.
Employees in the local recycling company have been on strike in Nabeul.

Clashes erupted on Wednesday in Tunisia's border town of Ben Guerdane between police and protesters demanding the free flow of vital trade with neighbouring Libya. Protesters set fire to tyres and blocked the road between Ben Guerdane and the border crossing of Ras Jedir about 30 kilometres (20 miles) away. They gathered outside official buildings in Ben Guerdane and security forces intervened after they were targeted by stone-throwers.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
NOTES: A group of people from Ouled Bousmir blocked the road to protest and demand the liberation of two relatives currently detained in prison. Units of the National Guard dispersed the crowd.
Protesters staged a march in Thala on January 11 setting tyres on fire and blocking the road.
Teachers staged a protest sit-in outside the Ministry of Education in Kasbah.
A protest was organised outside the delegation of Kasserine Nord.
A group of strikers in Sbeitla assaulted a public official and threatened him to burn his car.
Protests were reported in the southern town of Tataouine.

A general strike was organised in the delegation of Meknassi by the URT. Public offices were closed down while a group of citizens gathered in protest in the city centre. Protests turned violent in the evening.

SOURCE: Mosaique FM; Maghreb Emergent; Tunisie Numerique
NOTES: A general strike was organised in Ben Gardane following an initiative of the UGTT's secretary general. The organisation denounced the violent behaviour of the security forces the day before. The protest became violent in the evening when youths blocked roads with burning tyres.
A landmine exploded and injured a soldier in Jebel Semmama.
Protests continued in Ben Gardane on Friday.
Clashes were reported between police and protesters in Sidi Bouzid on Friday. Protests were also reported in Menzel Bouzayene area.
Protests erupted in Mazouna.
Clashes continued on Friday in Meknassi.
Clashes were reported between police and protesters in Sidi Bouzid on Friday. Protests were also reported in Menzel Bouzayene area.
A second landmine injured a shepherd.
Employees in the national railway company striked in Gabes and Tunis provinces.
Employees in the national railway company striked in Gabes and Tunis provinces.
A peaceful march was staged on Saturday in Meknassi. Tensions between protesters and police erupted lter in the day.
On the sixth anniversary of the revolution, several demonstrations were held across Tunisia. In Ben Gardane, protesters threw stones to the police who intervened to disperse the crowds.
Riots in Gafsa were reported as the President Essebsi visits the city.
On the sixth anniversary of the revolution, several demonstrations were held across Tunisia. In Kairouan, there were clashes between police and demonstrators.
Rioteres burnt a train carrying phosphate in Metlaoui.
On the sixth anniversary of the revolution, several demonstrations were held across Tunisia. In Feriana, violent riots were also reported.
On the sixth anniversary of the revolution, several demonstrations were held across Tunisia. In Menzel Bouzaiene, protesters staged a march and set tyres on fire.
A group of people injured by the police during the 2011 uprisings staged a protest sit-in in central Tunis on Saturday.
Police used teargas to disperse rioters in Sidi Bouzid and Meknassi.
Gunmen on a motorcycle shot fire against a security patrol in Ben Gardane. No casualties reported.
A police officer exchanged gunfire with unknown gunmen who threw a molotov cocktail against a police station in Menzel Jemil. One man was arrested.
Police used teargas to disperse rioters in Sidi Bouzid and Meknassi.
A sit-in took place in Meknassi to protest the use of teargas by the police the day before.
Young people from the region of Kairouan protested in Hajeb al Aioun demanding development and jobs.
A group of young people from Cite Ain Al Khadhra used burning tyres and erected roadblocks in sign of protest against the deteriorating living conditions.
Police dispersed violent demonstrators using teargas.
Unemployed people blocked the road linking Gafsa to Sfax near Sened. Police intervened firing teargas. Protests continued through Tuesday.
Police fired teargas to disperse demonstrators who erected roadblocks in Meknassi on 17 January.
The citizens of Ben Gardane have decided to continue their protest sit-in despite an agreement between the Libyan and the Tunisian authorities that restores cross-border trade in Ras Ajdir.
Police fired teargas near Le Kef as protesters burn tyres to block the roads. Protesters denounced the marginalisation of their area.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Tunisia (2014-); Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
NOTES: Security agents and National Guard officersprotested in Gabes against the return of foreign fighters on Tunisian soil.
Unemployed people blocked the road linking Gafsa to Sfax near Sened. Police intervened firing teargas. Protests continued through Tuesday.

After days of extreme weather that caused the isolation of certain remote areas, residents of Ain Draham tried to assault the local gas deposit and were repelled by police. Tyres were burnt in the town centre.
Protests blocked the circulation of vehicles in Feriana.
Two young unemployed attempted suicide inside the offices of the governorate of Kasserine in an extreme act of protest.
The roads were blocked in Mezzouna as unemployed erected barricades in sign of protest.
The illegal occupants of public housing residences staged a protest outside Beja governorate and demand the regularisation of their current situation.

Protestors in Ras Jedir Thursday prevented the passage of Libyan travellers through the border post to protest against the decisions made at the Tunisian-Libyan meeting held on Tuesday at the border post which, according to them, did not take into account their demands concerning the transport of fuels from Libya and the removal of customs duties applied on Tunisians.
The oilfields owned by the foreign company Winstar in Tataouine were shut down due to a strike.
The family of a shepherd killed by armed militants in the mountains of Kasserine staged a protest inside the offices of the delegation of Sbiba.
Jewellers went on strike in central Tunis after a robbery.
The employees of Attijari Bank went on strike across Tunisia.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SNFSI: National Union of Internal Security Forces
NOTES: Security forces protested in Sousse against the return of foreign fighters onto Tunisian soil.
A demonstration was organised un central Tunis by former students injured by police during the revolution. Limited clashes with the police were reported.
The army bombed militant positions in Jebel Mghilla.
Parents of students staged a protest in Majel Bel Abbes over alleged mismanagement.
Citizens of Oued Khatef protested to demand that their locality is merged with Azmour and that the local post office is reopened.
Protesters shut down the offices of the Phosphate Company in Redeyef.
Residents of Sidi Ali Ben Aoun protested after authorities destroyed illegal settlements.
Protesters blocked the road in Al Ain after a young man from the region committed suicide.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SNFSI: National Union of Internal Security Forces
NOTES: Security forces organised a protest march in Gafsa over the return of foreign fighters in Tunisia.
Taxi drivers from Ariana protested outside the offices of Shems FM in Tunis.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
NOTES: National Guard agents protested in Bizerte demanding security sector reform.
The family of a soldier killed in his house last November entered on hunger strike.

Citizens of Sened delegation started a general strike after the arrest of three demonstrators from the region. A march was organised by political parties and civil society organisations in the main town of the region.
A group of young unemployed blocked road near Skhira to protest the absence of their names from the lists of recruitment in a local company.
A protest organised by employees blocked the circulation of vehicles in Fouchana on Thursday.
Medical staff protested in Sfax Thursday.
The owners of car renting businesses protested in Tunis.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Tunisia); UGTT: Tunisian General Labour Union
NOTES: Students striked in Tataouine, UGTT reports.
A Tunisian citizen was assaulted by unidentified gunmen near Jebel Mghila. The area is regularly raided by armed Islamists who hide in the mountains nearby.
The town of Nefta saw demonstrations over three days as citizens protested the nomination of a new government delegate.
A landmine exploded on Jebel Semmama. No human casualties but a donkey died in the blast.
The town of Nefta saw demonstrations over three days as citizens protested the nomination of a new government delegate.
The town of Nefta saw demonstrations over three days as citizens protested the nomination of a new government delegate.
Young people from Ain el Karma near Tamazgah protested over unemployment.
Farmers staged a protest sit-in in Meknassi.
Protests in Beja after a girl was killed and her corpse burned.
Medical staff from Ibn Nazzar hospital in kairouan protested over rampant violence in the hospital premises.
Yemeni students protested outside their embassy to demand the payment of their scholarships.
A general strike was organised on February 1 in Hajeb el Layoun area of Kairouan.
Train passengers staged a protest in Tebourba against the national train company's misservice.
New protests erupted in Meknassi on February 2.
Taxi drivers protested outside the local administration's offices in Gabes.
The spokesmen of the Defense Ministry reported that two soldiers were injured during a combing operation in Jebel Chaambi.
Medical staff of Medjez el Bab hospital staged a strike on February 2 to demand more surveillance.
Graduate students demonstrated in Gafsa.
In sign of protest, a man offered his children for sale outside the regional administration's offices in Sfax. He wants to call attention to his precarious family situation.
14 fishermen were assaulted by gunmen on a Libyan boat off the coast of Medenine. One was kidnapped.
Popular Front members organised a march to demand truth on the assassination of Chokri Belaid, killed in 2013.
Doctors protested in Sousse over two days after the arrest of two colleagues.

Several citizens, independent and civil society representatives rallied, Sunday morning, outside the Tunis Municipal Theatre to reaffirm their "outright opposition" to the return of Tunisian terrorists from areas of tension.
Protests were reported in Meknassi on Monday.
Doctors protested in Sousse over two days after the arrest of two colleagues. A demonstration was reported on Monday in Kebili.
Journalists staged a protest in Sfax on Monday.
Doctors protested in Sousse over two days after the arrest of two colleagues.
Unemployed people staged a protest outside the Presidency of the Government in Kasbah on Tuesday.
A strike disrupted lectures in a college in Nabeul.
Doctors staged a nationwide strike on Wednesday to demand the institution of a statute of doctors.
In addition to a nationwide strike, doctors protested outside the Presidency of the Government in Kasbah (Tunis).
Former students whose recruitment in the police was rejected protested in central Tunis. On the same day, the Popular Front organised a march to demand truth about the death of Chokri Belaid.
New protests in Kasbah, Tunis, as construction workers took to the streets.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SNFSI: National Union of Internal Security Forces
NOTES: Security forces organised a sit-in in Monastir to demand that the victims of the revolution received their indemnities.
Civil society organised a protest march in Sfax after a girl died in hospital.
Farmers protested in Sidi Bouzid.
The civil society of Tozeur staged a protest to oppose the rebuilding of the tribunal in a tourist area.

Workers at Kakira Sugar Factory went on a sit down strike on 13 May. The workers had put down their tools protesting against low wages and arrest of their colleagues who were also participating in the protest. They attempted to set the sugar cane plantations ablaze but police responded on time to arrest 23 of them.
Workers are demonstrating and striking to protest sexual harassment at a Chinese-owned construction company.
101 M23 rebels, who had escaped from the Bihanga Military Training School in Uganda, were intercepted on their way to the DRC. They are currently detained at Makenke Barracks.
A man was stabbed to death on his way home from Arua town. His village believes that the perpetrators were Kakwa and Yivo who targeted him because he is Galanji.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Kakwa Ethnic Group (Uganda); Yivo Ethnic Group (Uganda)
NOTES: Galanji villagers attacked Kakwa and Yivo people, beating them, burning their huts, and looting livestock. Close to 60 homesteads have been abandoned, as the people fled to the DRC.
A crowd of people attacked and tried to lynch a man accused of rape. The police fired shots to disperse the mob.

Police discovered that local residents were plotting to attack Nakivale Refugee Camp over land tensions, so they arrested the ringleaders. The residents broke into a violent demonstration, blocking the road to the refugee camp. The police responded with teargas and bullets. A number of people were arrested.
750 M23 militants are reported to have escaped this week from Bihanga Military Training Camp.
700 miners at Konkola Copper Mine are refusing to work over a salary dispute.
Following orders from the party Secretary General, PF cadres have taken over the bus station and are using buses to extort money for the party.
Zambian Railway workers are on strike to demand better conditions for service. The Zambia Railways Limited has locked the workers out of the premises.
Students at privately-owned Apex University demonstrated against the high fees at the university.
A group of marketers marched to show their support for Lungu and the mayor of Kitwe, who is being criticised for evicting vendors.
Copperbelt University lecturers and staff are striking to protest that their salaries have not yet been paid this year.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
ALLY_ACTOR_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
NOTES: ZANU-PF supporters assaulted an MDC-T supporter for wearing party regalia
The Police Support Unit assaulted 3 men who were accused of illegally mining diamonds.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: A vendor selling wares close to Harvest House was assaulted by ZANU PF supporters who were riding around town in a truck chanting slogans.
Shona miners attacked Ndebele miners with machetes. 6 people were hospitalised. The military has been deployed to calm the situation.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: NCA candidate, Madock Chivasa, and his election agent were ambushed and attacked by 10 unidentified ZANU youths while campaigning for the Bikita West by-election.
Vendors fought running battles with the police, who came to enforce a ban on the sale of all foodstuffs.
The Police Support Unit tortured 4 men and 2 women who were accused of mining diamonds illegally.
A member of Zim PF was attacked by unidentified assailants in Chitungwiza.
The Police Support Unit assaulted a man accused of illegally mining diamonds.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
ALLY_ACTOR_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
NOTES: An MDC-T supporter was assaulted by ZANU youths at the 4th Street Bus Terminus for wearing a shirt promoting human rights.

Riots broke out in central Harare as vendors fought running battles with the police, who were trying to confiscate their wares and arrest them for vending. A vendor sustained injuries when he was attacked.

ACTOR2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: Violent clashes broke out between bus operators and ZANU youths, who were trying to claim space in the bus terminus under the guise of the anti-typhoid clean-up.

Municipal Officers assaulted a female vendor during a typhoid clean-up campaign. A passer-by asked why they were assaulting her. He was taken to the Municipal Police Headquarters and assaulted. Another female vendor was also taken to the Headquarters and assaulted.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: A youth was attacked by ZANU PF supporters, who accused him of influencing people to vote against Mugabe in 2018.
2 vendors selling wares outside Harvest House were attacked by Riot Police. 1 was arrested and taken to Harare Central Police Station, where he was beaten using metal road spikes.
A vendor outside Harvest House was attacked by police officers, who broke his leg.
Supporters of Pastor Evan Mawarire gathered at the courts to support him. He had been arrested as he tried to enter the country.
A female vendor was seized by the police, beaten, and thrown into a police vehicle, leaving her 2 year old child on the street. She has not been located.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: ZANU PF youths attacked members of Transform Zimbabwe who were holding a street cleaning community service exercise in Chitungwiza. 3 people have been hospitalised.
